os.fullpath: Operating System :: Grouping and Descriptive Categories :: All POSIX (Linux/BSD/UNIX-like OSes)

name: uso
short_description:
This small C program searches in a given path the largest files and directories. Directory sizes are calculated recursively. Sizes are shown in human readable form.

Example usage and output:

$ uso /var/log
41.6KB /var/log/auth.log.1
42.1KB /var/log/ConsoleKit/
54.5KB /var/log/installer/status
60.7KB /var/log/apt/
62.7KB /var/log/dmesg
62.8KB /var/log/dmesg.0
73.9KB /var/log/Xorg.0.log.old
81.7KB /var/log/daemon.log.2.gz
90.9KB /var/log/user.log.1
93.4KB /var/log/syslog.1
 111KB /var/log/messages.2.gz
 118KB /var/log/installer/cdebconf/questions.dat
 122KB /var/log/kern.log.2.gz
 128KB /var/log/wtmp.1
 128KB /var/log/dpkg.log.1
 162KB /var/log/daemon.log.1
 206KB /var/log/kern.log.1
 296KB /var/log/messages.1
 350KB /var/log/lastlog
 759KB /var/log/installer/syslog
 881KB /var/log/installer/partman
12.9MB /var/log/installer/cdebconf/templates.dat
13.0MB /var/log/installer/cdebconf/
14.7MB /var/log/installer/
17.3MB /var/log/
summary: Command line utility to show large files and directories.
